column.name: TRANCODE
column.comment: Indicator for a record type for delta tables, N => New, M => Modify, D => Delete

column.name: DWH_SOURCE_IND
column.comment: Indicator from which system the data record comes (2: Debit, 3: Credit).

column.name: MARKET_CODE
column.comment: Market to which the customer is assigned. Examples are MMC (credit customers who have a contract with VfD2), PUC (credit customers who have a contract with a partner company), MMO (prepaid customers who are directly assigned to VfD2), PUA (prepdaid customers who have a partner company) are), XMK ​​(Cross Market).

column.name: BAN
column.comment: Indication of the customer's billing account number. The customer is the (natural or legal) person to whom services are provided on the basis of a contract concluded with D2-Vodafone. The customer is responsible for payment for the services used by himself or by other participants belonging to him. If the customer account is assigned to a higher-level account (consolidated account), the higher-level account can also be responsible for payment.

column.name: SYS_CREATION_DATE
column.comment: Date of creation of the data record in the operative system

column.name: SYS_UPDATE_DATE
column.comment: Date of modification of the data record in the operative system

column.name: OPERATOR_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the last user

column.name: APPLICATION_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the application that last processed the sentence

column.name: CURR_ROOT_BAN
column.comment: Current Root Ban

column.name: NEXT_ROOT_BAN
column.comment: Regarding the hierarchical billing issue. If a customer wishes to change his major account, this field is populated by the new major account. On bill day, bill confirmation moves this field to the CURRENT_ROOT_BAN field, which is cleared.

column.name: PARTITION_ROOT_BAN
column.comment: The ID of the ROOT BAN used for oracle partitioning. For a hierarchical BAN, this is the CURRENT_ROOT_BAN. Otherwise, it is the BAN.

column.name: AR_EXCPT_ACCT_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether or not the BAN is written-off.

column.name: ACCOUNT_TYPE
column.comment: Type of Account

column.name: ACCOUNT_SUB_TYPE
column.comment: Subset of the account type

column.name: EU_AR_BALANCE
column.comment: Represents the BAN total billing debt in Euro.

column.name: BAN_STATUS
column.comment: Status of BAN (N,C,S,O,T)

column.name: HIST_LAST_DATE
column.comment: Contains the date of the last update of the BAN history entity due to data change.

column.name: STATUS_ACTV_CODE
column.comment: Contains the CSM activity code that determined the current BAN status. This includes various activities on the BAN or the CTN level that can affect the BAN status.

column.name: STATUS_ACTV_RSN_CODE
column.comment: Contains the CSM activity reason code that determined the current BAN status.

column.name: AR_WO_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether or not the BAN is written-off.

column.name: START_SERVICE_DATE
column.comment: Start Date of Service

column.name: DEFAULT_SUB_MARKET
column.comment: Submarket code for BAN level activities.

column.name: DEFAULT_DEPARTMENT
column.comment: Department code for BAN level activities.

column.name: COL_DELINQ_STATUS
column.comment: Indicates whether the account is considered delinquent.

column.name: COL_DELINQ_STS_DATE
column.comment: Contains the date on which the delinquency indicator was set.

column.name: BILL_CYCLE
column.comment: Encryption of the monthly invoice run for which the invoice is created for the customer. The entries always enter the day of the month in which the billing room begins, which then ends on entry - 1 of the following month (e.g. entry 22 denotes the billing period from the 22nd to the 21st of the following month).

column.name: BL_CUR_BILL_SEQ_NO
column.comment: The sequence number of the current bill. The current bill is the bill that will be prepared on the next bill day of this particular BAN.

column.name: BL_LAST_PROD_DATE
column.comment: Contains the period coverage end date of the last bill.

column.name: BL_VAT_EXEMPT_IND
column.comment: The indicator indicates whether the BAN is tax exempted. Valid values: "Y" - there is an exemption, "N" - there is no exemption.

column.name: BL_VAT_EXEMPT_DATE
column.comment: The date on which the tax exemption becomes valid.

column.name: BL_VAT_EXEMPT_REF_NO
column.comment: The reference number of the VAT exemption indication.

column.name: BL_VAT_EXEMPT_RSN_CD
column.comment: The tax exemption reason code.

column.name: BL_LAST_CYC_RUN_YEAR
column.comment: The year in which the previous cycle was run for this BAN.

column.name: BL_LAST_CYC_RUN_MNTH
column.comment: The month in which the previous cycle was run for this BAN.

column.name: BL_LAST_CYC_CODE
column.comment: The code of the previous cycle for this BAN.

column.name: BL_LAST_RG_BL_SEQ_NO
column.comment: Handles an expedite bill situation.

column.name: BL_LAST_RG_CYC_DATE
column.comment: Contains the date on which a regular bill was produced for this BAN.

column.name: BL_COMPLT_STATUS
column.comment: Specifies how the last BILL run for this BAN ended.

column.name: BL_COMPLT_DATE
column.comment: Date of Completion

column.name: BL_SPECIAL_CYCLE
column.comment: If the bill is to be produced in a special cycle, the special cycle's number is written here.

column.name: BL_SPECL_CYCL_TYPE
column.comment: Currently not in use.

column.name: BL_PRT_CATEGORY
column.comment: This field indicates the print status of the bill.

column.name: BL_ZERO_BALANC_IND
column.comment: There are certain cases in which the bill's balance is to be zeroed, regardless of the amount. One such case is a bill that belongs to an employee of the company. Bill preparation refers to these bills as internal bills.

column.name: BL_MAN_HNDL_RSN
column.comment: The reason if the bill is held up for inspection by a company billing clerk.

column.name: BL_MAN_HNDL_EFF_DATE
column.comment: The date by which the bill is to be handled manually.

column.name: BL_MAN_HNDL_EXP_DATE
column.comment: The expiration date for a held bill.

column.name: BL_MAN_HNDL_REQ_OPID
column.comment: The identification of the company employee who requested the manual handling of the BAN.

column.name: BL_MAN_HNDL_BY_OPID
column.comment: The identification of the company employee who will actually handle the BAN.

column.name: BL_REQ_ST_GRACE_PRD
column.comment: The start date of the grace period. This field is relevant only if the PP is at the BAN level and includes minimum requirements.

column.name: BL_REQ_END_GRACE_PRD
column.comment: The end date of the grace period. This field is relevant only if the PP is at the BAN level and includes minimum requirements.

column.name: BL_NEXT_CYCLE
column.comment: When a customer wishes to change his bill cycle, this field is populated by the new cycle code. When the bill day of the new cycle arrives, Billing moves this field to the BILL_CYCLE field, and this field is cleared.

column.name: BL_NEXT_CYC_EFF_DATE
column.comment: The date from when the next cycle will be effective. Usually one day after the regular bill day.

column.name: BL_SUSP_RC_RATE_TYPE
column.comment: This attribute specifies the recurring rate type in cases of suspension.

column.name: BL_BILL_PROD_IND
column.comment: Indicates if a bill is produced for the type of account (for example: no bill for ECA).

column.name: BL_BAL_HANDLE_IND
column.comment: Indicates if the balance is maintained for an account of this type.

column.name: BL_UD_LST_PROD_DATE
column.comment: Undo the last production date.

column.name: BL_UD_LST_CYC_RUN_YR
column.comment: Undo the last production year.

column.name: BL_UD_LST_CYC_RUN_MN
column.comment: Undo the last production month.

column.name: BL_UD_LST_RG_BL_SEQNO
column.comment: Undo the last regular bill sequence number.

column.name: BL_UD_LST_RG_CYC_DATE
column.comment: Undo the last regular bill cycle date.

column.name: BL_UD_LST_CYC_CD
column.comment: Undo the last bill cycle code.

column.name: BL_UD_SPCL_CYC
column.comment: For Undo

column.name: BL_UD_SPCL_CYC_TYPE
column.comment: For Undo

column.name: BL_LST_BAN_DIS_DT
column.comment: The last time a BAN received a BAN discount.

column.name: BL_LST_HIER_DIS_DT
column.comment: The last time a BAN received a hierarchical discount.

column.name: BL_LST_TREE_DIS_DT
column.comment: The last time a tree discount was given.

column.name: BL_LST_BAN_DIS_DT_U
column.comment: For undo purposes

column.name: BL_LST_HIER_DIS_DT_U
column.comment: For undo purposes

column.name: BL_LST_TREE_DIS_DT_U
column.comment: For undo purposes

column.name: BL_LST_BAN_DIS_SN
column.comment: The bill-seq-no that was current when the BAN discount was last given.

column.name: BL_LST_HIER_DIS_SN
column.comment: The bill-seq-no that was current when the hierarchical discount was last given.

column.name: BL_LST_TREE_DIS_SN
column.comment: The bill-seq-no that was current when tree discount was last given.

column.name: BL_LST_BAN_DIS_SN_U
column.comment: For undo purposes

column.name: BL_LST_HIER_DIS_SN_U
column.comment: For undo purposes

column.name: BL_LST_TREE_DIS_SN_U
column.comment: For undo purposes

column.name: BL_HIER_BAN_IND
column.comment: Indicates if the BAN is a hierarchical BAN.

column.name: BL_DUE_DAY
column.comment: The payment due day of the bill.

column.name: VIP_IND
column.comment: Indicates if the BAN is defined as VIP.

column.name: ORG_CODE
column.comment: Used for formatting purposes to distinguish between organizations.

column.name: CYCLE_FREQUENCY
column.comment: Cycle duration. Valid Values are: 1 - monthly, 2 - bi-monthly, 3 - quarterly.

column.name: CYCLE_FIRST_BILL_MONTH
column.comment: Relevant only for non monthly cycles. Defines the first month of the first cycle in the year. Valid values 1, 2, 3.

column.name: EDI_LOCATION_NUMBER
column.comment: Used by the FBF.

column.name: CS_MIN_REQ_CTNS
column.comment: If there is a Price Plan requirement for the minimum number of CTNs, this number overrides the Price Plan.

column.name: CS_COM_START_DATE
column.comment: Commitment start date. The date on which the subscriber was activated.

column.name: CS_COM_END_DATE
column.comment: Commitment end date. If the customer terminates the commitment before it has ended, the customer pays an early termination penalty.

column.name: CS_COM_REASON_CODE
column.comment: The customer reason for the commitment.

column.name: CS_COM_ORIG_NO_MONTH
column.comment: Specifies the commitment period in months.

column.name: CS_FOLLOW_UPS_STATE
column.comment: Accumulates the number of follow-ups opened for the BAN. Thus, serves as an indicator as to whether or not open follow-ups exist.

column.name: CS_SPEC_MEMO_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether a special instructions memo exists for the BAN.

column.name: STATUS_ISSUE_DATE
column.comment: The logical date on which the status was set. It can be different from STATUS_DATE for future actions or for backdated actions.

column.name: CS_BAN_TRX_OFF_IND
column.comment: Flag for a Big BAN, which sends the activity to the Batch Transaction process.

column.name: CS_HANDLE_BY_CTN_IND
column.comment: Flag for Big BANs. When Big BAN requests the CSR to input the subscriber it wishes to handle.

column.name: CS_LOCK_MECHANISM
column.comment: An online flag indicates that the BAN is already locked. Relevant only for the Move CTN activity.

column.name: CS_DEF_PRODUCT_TYPE
column.comment: The default LOCS of the customer

column.name: CONV_RUN_NO
column.comment: Used for conversion.

column.name: CARRY_OVER_BILL
column.comment: If the amount of the bill is lower than a defined threshold, the amount is transferred to the next bill.

column.name: SEC_DEPARTMENT
column.comment: Security department. Used to determine which department is allowed to handle the BAN.

column.name: PAYABLE_LTR_SEND_DATE
column.comment: The last date on which a payable letter was sent to the BAN (because of DD reject )

column.name: NEXT_CONF_ROOT_BAN
column.comment: Used for a change root BAN request in the period between billing and confirmation

column.name: LAST_CONF_DATE
column.comment: The last time the confirmation job handled this BAN.

column.name: ACCOUNT_OWNERSHIP
column.comment: Indicates the account owner, whether the owner belongs to the company or is a service provider. The attribute's value is the company code or the code of the service provider.

column.name: MAJOR_CURRENCY
column.comment: The major currency of the account.

column.name: EU_CS_PEN_MS_CTN
column.comment: If the Price Plan contains a requirement for a minimum number of CTNs, this field is the penalty for a missing CTN (in Euro).

column.name: AUTO_REFUND_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether the account should be refunded automatically when it is in overpayment.

column.name: PYM_MT_MST_SVR_RSN
column.comment: Indicates the most severe reversal reason from a change payment method point of view.

column.name: COL_MOST_SEVERE_RSN
column.comment: Indicates the most severe reversal reason from a collection point of view.

column.name: ORIGIN_PYM_METHOD
column.comment: The account's original payment method when it was opened.

column.name: GL_COMPANY_TYPE
column.comment: Defines the account characteristics that are used as breakdowns for the G/L.

column.name: COL_TK_IND
column.comment: Indicates that information about the customer was sent to Schufa. This indicator results in specific text being added to a separate section of the collection letter.

column.name: LETTER_COPY_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether the customer wants collection correspondence sent to both the legal and billing addresses (if different).

column.name: FRAUD_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether the account is fraudulent.

column.name: UNKNOWN_ADDR_IND
column.comment: Indicates that the address is unknown. The final bill will be held until the address is corrected.

column.name: BANKRUPTCY_IND
column.comment: Indicates if the account is bankrupt.

column.name: PYM_ARRANGE_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether the account has a payment arrangement.

column.name: RISK_CHK_FU_IND
column.comment: Indicates that a follow-up was sent to the back office to verify whether a manual risk point needs to be set.

column.name: MATCH_CODE_FU_IND
column.comment: When the match percentage is above the minimum threshold but below the auto-link threshold, this indicator shows that a follow-up was sent to the back office to check if this BAN should be linked to other BANs.

column.name: CREDIT_EVAL_FU_IND
column.comment: Indicates that a follow-up was sent to the back office because the external credit class is 'Manual Handling'.

column.name: EMP_COMPANY_ID
column.comment: The Mannesmann company to which the employee belongs.

column.name: EMPLOYEE_ID
column.comment: The ID of the employee in the Mannesmann company.

column.name: RETIRED_DATE
column.comment: The retirement date of the Mannesmann employee.

column.name: RETIREMENT_REASON
column.comment: The retirement reason of the Mannesmann employee.

column.name: PREPAID_IND
column.comment: Indicates wether the subscriber's BAN has a prepaid (debit) account, credit account or callya roaming account. Valid values are:  Y - prepaid, R - prepaid roaming, N - credit.

column.name: SKELETON_CONTRACT_NUM
column.comment: Framework agreement number

column.name: BILLING_ADDRESS_MOD_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether the billing address was changed from the legal address.

column.name: HOTLINE_IND
column.comment: Indicator for dunning account

column.name: SAP_ACCOUNT_NUM
column.comment: The ID of the related SAP (external accounting system) account.

column.name: SAP_ACCOUNT_TYPE
column.comment: The type of the related SAP (external accounting system) account. Valid values: R - Regular, D - Dealer, B - Bertelsmann.

column.name: IMM_CHANGE_CYC_IND
column.comment: Immediate Change Cycle Code.

column.name: PREPAID_INVOICE_REQ
column.comment: Indicates wether the subscriber's BAN has a prepaid (debit) account, credit account or callya roaming account. Valid values are:  Y - prepaid, R - prepaid roaming, N - credit.

column.name: ELECT_BILL_REQ
column.comment: Indicates if a customer requested an electronic bill.

column.name: BAN_TARIFF_OPTION
column.comment: This field contains the BAN level tariff option (if defined). All subscribers of the BAN will have this tariff option. Any new subscriber that is opened for the BAN will inherit this tariff option, with no option to override.

column.name: MIN_REQ_IND
column.comment: Indicates that the BAN level tariff option (if defined) has a minimum requirement of subscribers. It is used to identify BANs with a minimum subscribers requirement for reporting purposes.

column.name: BIRTH_DATE
column.comment: Date of Birth

column.name: RETIRED_END_DATE
column.comment: For a temporarily retired MMO employee, this date is the date on which the retirement period finishes.

column.name: BANK_GUARANTEE_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether or not a Bank guarantee was given for the account.

column.name: VAT_EXMPT_EXP_DATE
column.comment: The date when the tax exemption expires.

column.name: DEPOSIT_LETTER_DATE
column.comment: Holds the date of the last deposit letter.

column.name: D2_ACTIVATE_FU_IND
column.comment: Indicates that a follow-up was sent to the back office for manual handling of D2-Activate issues.

column.name: COMPANY_ID
column.comment: A unique sequence representing a company in the Skeleton area.

column.name: INITIAL_CREDIT_TWIN
column.comment: Indicates if this BAN receives a TWIN STAR initial Credit (Bonus).

column.name: ORIGIN_PYM_SUB_MTD
column.comment: The payment sub-method by which the customer chooses to pay.

column.name: LINK_ACT_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether relevant for BAN link.

column.name: BL_NUM_OF_CTNS
column.comment: The actual number of subscribers reported in the current bill. Note that Disconnected, Suspended, and Cancelled subscribers are also counted here if they were active throughout the billed period or any charge or adjustment for them was included in the billed period.

column.name: BL_CTNS_CYCLE_CODE
column.comment: The relevant cycle that was used for counting the number of subscribers.

column.name: BL_CTNS_EFF_DATE
column.comment: The effective date on which the number of subscribers was counted.

column.name: TAX_INFO_IND
column.comment:
Indicator based on which is decided if the informational text will be printed on the invoices. - Y: Print text, 
N: No text printing

column.name: EXT_TERM_OF_PYM
column.comment: extended terms of payment in days

column.name: ROOT_BAN_INFO_CD
column.comment: The column indicates the Root Ban typecode. In case the Root Ban is dedicated to Vodafone Employees, the value of the indicator has to be populated with 'E'.  Otherwise it has to be Null.
